result.execSummary:
The defendant Alisa M Decubellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees.  $200 DNA surcharge assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.   Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. No contact with the victim unless approved by the agent.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alisa M Decubellis
